reviewText: Great zany classical import from the UK with wonderful comedic actors early in their careers shown on MTV. Definitely worth watching again.
Title: The Young Ones - Series One [Pal, Region 2, Import]

reviewText: if you have seen this before then watch again as it is funnier the second time around. If you have not seen it then you are either a yank or you grew up in a house that was NOT as cultured as mine. Watch the video....laugh....smile....and know that life will be there when you turn off the tv. this episode is par for the course.... A plus.
summary: the young ones is not just funny!
Title: The Young Ones - Series One [Pal, Region 2, Import]

reviewText: foolish and tasteless.  Okay as white noise but not as watchable tv.  I am sorry i rented it and even sorrier i wasted my time.
summary: young ones, old premise, dated comedy
Title: The Young Ones - Series One [Pal, Region 2, Import]

reviewText: With episodes like `demolition', `boring' and `flood', series one introduces us to Rick, Mike, Neil and Vyv. I watch this series the first time when I was a kid, in the '80s. My brothers and cousins were big fans and fair to say I struggled to follow (as a 5-year-old). Even now some of the political wit is above my simple humour, but like the Simpsons, this is a show that has something for everyone. `Rick with a silent p' is a phrase that is now common-place in our family!
Title: The Young Ones - Series One [Pal, Region 2, Import]

reviewText: The Young Ones is a not-to-be missed blast-from-the-past. It will feel dated, but in a good 80's way. I will never think of lentils in the same way while I run around being an anarchist while living with the bomb. Enjoy, or not.
summary: Ah, the Reagan & Thatcher Era with Anarchy
Title: The Young Ones - Series One [Pal, Region 2, Import]
